ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ValueRange: American Indian/Alaska Native; Asian; Hawaiian or Pacific Islander; Black or African American; White; More than one race; Unknown or not reported; Other Non-White; Other

Notes: The following questions are about you or the child's family.

ValueRange: Hispanic or Latino; Not Hispanic or Latino; Unknown

ElementDescription: Participant choice: to indicate whether he/she viewed the stimulus as negative, positive, or neutral.
Was the judgment correct or incorrect
Whether the participant rated the face as positive, neutral, or negative
Comparing the valence of the face-sentence pair with the judgment
Notes: 1 = negative judged negative; 2 = negative judged neutral; 3 = negative judged positive; 4 = positive judged negative; 5 = positive judged neutral; 6 = positive judged positive; 7 = neutral judged negative; 8 = neutral judged neutral; 9 = neutral judged positive; 10 = extra judged negative; 11 = extra judged neutral; 12 = extra judged positive

ElementDescription: Was the Negative Judgment Correctly judged negative?
Was the Positive Judgment Correctly judged positive?
Was the Neutral Judgment Correctly judged neutral?
Was the Extra Judgment Correctly judged negative/positive/neutral?
